alert.note: Alert for Brown (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 3:53AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following county, Brown. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. State Road 46 is closed between State Road 135 and Valley Branch Road due to flooding. Low lying roads in nearby terrain may also be inundated. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nashville, Gnaw Bone, Stone Head, Story, Spurgeons Corner, Spearsville, Beanblossom, Elkinsville and Peoga. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
